header: Gathering the news for the Perlweekly is usually a joyful affair. But sometimes the regular technical wonderments and political melodrama are eclipsed by some sobering news. Alas, Nóirín Plunkett passed away last week. They were a contributor to many projects, a vibrant part of many of the Open Source communities, and a friend to many of us. They will be sorely missed. ~ `/anick
subject: Farewell, friend

entries.title: Morgan Stanley Budapest Perl developer for cloud
entries.text: Create internal cloud hosting solutions within Morgan Stanley. As a contributor on our budapest-based team, you will have responsibility to contribute not only to the code, but to the design and engineering of the full PaaS systems.

entries.title: Front-end with AngularJS, Back-end with Perl Dancer and MongoDB
entries.text: There are going to be 3 courses at YAPC::EU in Granada, Spain. At one of them you can learn how to use Angular JS together with Perl Dancer. Sign up now!

It is always a shock when a member of the community leaves us all too early. It is with great sadness that we learn that Nóirín -- contributor, advocate, but more importantly friend to many, many of us -- passed away.
entries.author: nova_patch
entries.title: Nóirín Plunkett

entries.text: Short and sweet example of how the currying pattern can help to stay DRY (that is: Don't Repeat Yourself).

entries.title: Currying patterns

entries.text: Patching modules is usually quick and easy. It's the mundane steps of repository cloning, git juggling and Pull Request crafting that usually take longer. fREW uses a mix of git-cpan, git-hub and fugitive.vim to smooth out that overhead.
entries.title: CPAN Patch workflow
entries.author: frew_schmidt

entries.title: CPAN Pull Request Challenge - July
entries.author: doyle_young
entries.text: Doyle was assigned MojoMojo which is a content management system that borrows concepts from wikis and blogs. He fixed a warning "Unescaped left brace in regex is deprecated, passed through in regex;"

entries.title: Modern Charting tools for Desktop Applications
entries.author: bakkiaraj_murugesan
entries.text: A GTK2 based dektop application written in Perl to demonstrate Java Script charting technique.

entries.title: Beginner Perl Maven video course
entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: The slidecast Perl tutorial has passed 148 freely available episodes. Available on YouTube or downloadable from the Perl Maven site.

entries.author: dave_jacoby
entries.title: Dave Jacoby (/var/log/rant): What Language Should I Learn? Three Answers
entries.text: That's a question that comes back over and over again. "Which language should I learn next?" Dave offers, and debates, three suggestions.

entries.title: P6SGI: Perl 6 Web Service Gateway Interface
entries.text: Sterling want to bring the goodness of PSGI to Perl 6, and to bring the goodness of Perl 6 to PSGI. He came up with specs for what P6SGI could be like, and now need some feedback.

A long, loooong time ago, Dave wrote an accounting system for his freelance activities. Nowadays, he uses a commercial solution, but he's sharing his old code for whoever who want to use it, learn from it, or just want a chuckle or two.
entries.author: dave_cross
entries.title: Driving a Business with Perl

entries.text: A nice show'n'tell on how to transform a regular image in a  hexagonal game tile using the module 'Imager'.

entries.title: Masking Images with Imager

entries.author: graham_ollis
entries.title: Making Alien::Base more reliable
entries.text: Using Alien::Base? Then this is a must-read, as it gives a few tips to make its use more robust.

entries.title: Perl5 to Java compiler is 1 month old, and we have a hackathon
entries.author: flavio_glock
entries.text: Interesting stuff happening on the Perlito front. Seems that a hackaton produced a Perl script that lives under its Java alter-ego in a HBase environment. As someone who worked with Hadoop not to long ago, this shines a brillant ray of hope over a potential huge new array of Big Data tools.
Less than one month to the workshop, and the schedule is now out to whet your appetite.
entries.title: Schedule for Swiss Perl Workshop 2015 ready
2015.29/30 FastForwarding To The Present
entries.text: What went on in the Perl6-sphere this week.

entries.title: This week: too little sleep and too little Perl 6
entries.author: jonathan_worthington
entries.text: This week it's baby steps for Jonathan, as his time for Perl 6 was scant. But baby steps are steps still -- he still managed to do some work on multi-dimensional arrays, improve some error messages, and also removed a road-block for the next release.
The Perl 6 implementation of a classic card game. With annotations too!
entries.title: Simple Game in Perl 6
Getting Started
entries.text: Aaron, a seasoned Perl 5 programmer, is taking the plunge into Perl 6, and gives us his impression as his dive makes him discover the strange new lifeforms of this new ecosystem.
